ticket.title: I18n incompatible character encodings: UTF-8 and US-ASCII
ticket.original-body: There's a problem with new I18n 0.3.5 gem and Rails 2.3.5. I18n tries to preserve string encoding in interpolation method, but some strings are hardcoded into Rails and have US-ASCII encoding. The key activerecord.errors.full_messages.format ("{{attribute}} {{message}}") is hardcoded in validations.rb file, and it needs to be UTF-8 encoded to work with other UTF-8 strings.
ticket.latest-body: There's a problem with new I18n 0.3.5 gem and Rails 2.3.5. I18n tries to preserve string encoding in interpolation method, but some strings are hardcoded into Rails and have US-ASCII encoding. The key activerecord.errors.full_messages.format ("{{attribute}} {{message}}") is hardcoded in validations.rb file, and it needs to be UTF-8 encoded to work with other UTF-8 strings.
ticket.original-body-html: There's a problem with new I18n 0.3.5 gem and Rails 2.3.5. I18n tries to preserve string encoding in interpolation method, but some strings are hardcoded into Rails and have US-ASCII encoding. The key activerecord.errors.full_messages.format ("{{attribute}} {{message}}") is hardcoded in validations.rb file, and it needs to be UTF-8 encoded to work with other UTF-8 strings.

version.body: There's a problem with new I18n 0.3.5 gem and Rails 2.3.5. I18n tries to preserve string encoding in interpolation method, but some strings are hardcoded into Rails and have US-ASCII encoding. The key activerecord.errors.full_messages.format ("{{attribute}} {{message}}") is hardcoded in validations.rb file, and it needs to be UTF-8 encoded to work with other UTF-8 strings.
version.body-html: There's a problem with new I18n 0.3.5 gem and Rails 2.3.5. I18n tries to preserve string encoding in interpolation method, but some strings are hardcoded into Rails and have US-ASCII encoding. The key activerecord.errors.full_messages.format ("{{attribute}} {{message}}") is hardcoded in validations.rb file, and it needs to be UTF-8 encoded to work with other UTF-8 strings.
version.title: I18n incompatible character encodings: UTF-8 and US-ASCII

version.body: Hi Jakub, Can you provide a patch for this? Thanks.
version.body-html: Hi Jakub, Can you provide a patch for this? Thanks.
version.title: I18n incompatible character encodings: UTF-8 and US-ASCII

version.body:
The problem can be easily solved by defining custom "activerecord.errors.full_messages.format" key in your translations:
@@@ de: activerecord: errors: full_messages: format: "{{attribute}} {{message}}" @@@
I don't have time to make a patch right now, but it'd be really simple - all you need is to add magic comment with utf-8 encoding at the beginning of validations.rb file.
version.body-html:
The problem can be easily solved by defining custom "activerecord.errors.full_messages.format" key in your translations:

de:
  activerecord:
    errors:
      full_messages:
        format: "{{attribute}} {{message}}"

I don't have time to make a patch right now, but it'd be really simple - all you need is to add magic comment with utf-8 encoding at the beginning of validations.rb file.
version.title: I18n incompatible character encodings: UTF-8 and US-ASCII

version.body: For me, none of these solutions worked in Rails 3: * Add the "activerecord.errors.full_messages.format" key on translation file * Add # coding: utf-8 in validations.rb I'm using a portuguese translation and Rails 3.0.0beta0 on Ruby 1.9.1p378 on Mac OS X 10.6.
version.body-html:
For me, none of these solutions worked in Rails 3:
* Add the "activerecord.errors.full_messages.format" key on translation file * Add # coding: utf-8 in validations.rb I'm using a portuguese translation and Rails 3.0.0beta0 on Ruby 1.9.1p378 on Mac OS X 10.6.

version.title: I18n incompatible character encodings: UTF-8 and US-ASCII

version.body: Sorry, I just found out there is already the ticket #3941 for this problem on Rails 3. And it just got solved!

version.body:
Actually it's only resolved for Ralis3 but it's not solved for 2.3.8 or 2-3-stable branch and I just got bitten by it. It got some hours debugging for me to figure out where US-ASCII string comes in.
Anyhow, I made micro-patch against 2-3-stable and this problem should be solved now.
version.body-html:
Actually it's only resolved for Ralis3 but it's not solved for 2.3.8 or 2-3-stable branch and I just got bitten by it. It got some hours debugging for me to figure out where US-ASCII string comes in.

Anyhow, I made micro-patch against 2-3-stable and this problem should be solved now.
version.title: I18n incompatible character encodings: UTF-8 and US-ASCII

version.body: Thanks for your article. Have you noticed how many online Tennessee Titans Jerseys articles are boring rehash that leave you feeling like you want the 5 minutes it took to read each one back? Me too. Well, there's a reason why writing a good Minnesota Twins Jerseys article has become a lost art: chasing the almighty dollar. Website owners are looking for ways to get free traffic, and writing lots of Pittsburgh Penguins Jerseys articles with links in them has become one of the preferred methods. Look around and you'll find plenty of 'gurus' out there claiming they can teach you to write 20 Calgary Flames Jerseys articles a day so you can "dominate your competition." This is all well and good. I'd never begrudge someone their drive to earn a living online. But in the process of clamoring to write tons of Miami Heat Jerseys articles and saturate the Web, a simple truth has gotten buried... Writing a good article is still the best way to build traffic, gain a solid reputation, and take your online success to new Houston Texans heights. Having been an article writer and marketer for over a decade, I can tell you with certainty that the best articles I've ever written have also been the best performers in Tampa Bay Lightning terms of gaining my site backlinks and traffic. a good article will continue bringing in visitors for months - even years - after you wrote it. Writing an article that you've just thrown together often Colorado Rockies Jerseys ends up in oblivion very quickly. So, what are the keys to writing a good article? I think there are 3 big ones. I'm not talking about the MLB Baseball Jerseys mechanics here, but rather creating and maintaining the correct mindset. HYD

version.body: This supra footwear is called a modern vintage and has been since their introduction in 2003 where they began in Europe. Every supra shoes has some type of ornament, adornment or hardware and is comprised of aged leather that is bought from around the world. These supra uk are culturally engaging and allow for the woman wearing them to be enveloped in luxury.With new cuts and styles and hand stitched shoes, these timberland boots, heels or flats will make every foot look like it stepped out of vintage Hollywood. This timberland shoes have been worn and coveted by many of the most famous females in recent history. One such coach outlet, Jennifer Aniston, wears them in public and at home.This company makes many different unique styles of bags outlet from ankle booties to sandals, pumps, moncler jackets online, platforms and wedges. One louis vuitton bag in particular is ideal for the gothic style sense; it is patent leather and laces up the front of the shaft. There are also zippers on each side, and this shoe offers a flat heel of a half inch.Another great moncler jackets sale is featured in People's Style Watch and is called a platform bootie. This ture religion jeans has a raised panel in front of the ankle as well as a heel that measures 4.5 inches. The front offers a leather bandage appearance and is considered high fashion.
